course_name: Big Data Engineering Bootcamp with GCP, and Azure Cloud
content: This is a very good course on Udemy that explains the fundamental concepts of Spark and Hadoop clearly. I especially appreciated the industry-oriented Azure project, which effectively demonstrates process flow and the use of different cloud services. Kudos to Mayank for explaining the basics in depth—something many other courses overlook. While it may not be perfect, it exceeded my expectations by delivering far more value than anticipated.

content: The course is overall good and covers useful content, but I found it unnecessarily stretched and longer than it needs to be. course_name: Big Data Engineering Bootcamp with GCP, and Azure Cloud
content: The course offers a wide and diverse range of content, covering most key concepts thoroughly. While some instructions can be unclear and certain sections may require additional materials to fully follow, the overall value is excellent. Considering the price and its suitability for beginners, this is one of the best courses I can recommend.

course_name: Big Data Engineering Bootcamp with GCP, and Azure Cloud
content:
Thank you, Mayank Agarwal and Krish Naik. The overall course has provided me with a profound knowledge of Big Data Engineering. Your effort and simple analogy to understand concepts and processes are absolutely amazing, especially how you relate them to our real-life situations. While doing this course, I noticed some issues in some lectures; unfortunately, I didn't note them down to share with you. But I remember one thing: while we were using Azure Synapse and creating the first external table, you didn't create a gold schema. I understand you forgot to take a video of that, or you may have skipped. I successfully completed the course, now applying to jobs and preparing for the interviews. For the final project, I have done my version of that, just asked LLMs how in industry things will happen and did according. If you read my feedback and have spare time to see my version, please visit my GitHub and LinkedIn post, just see whether my work is right or not, and give the LinkedIn post a like, that will motivate and make me believe that I am on the right path.
GitHub: https://github.com/DHANA5982/Olist_ECommerce_Data_Pipeline
LinkedIn Post: https://www.linkedin.com/posts/dhanasekar-govindaraj-177096310_dataengineering-bigdata-datapipeline-activity-7377782314224963584-MCi_?utm_source=share&utm_medium=member_desktop&rcm=ACoAAE8IwmsB7XTwOGX2aCb9BlcJQGlfQiUWUBQ

course_name: Big Data Engineering Bootcamp with GCP, and Azure Cloud
content:
I have been stuyding AI/ML for the past 5 years. I even did a bachelor's and master's in it from top universities in the UK. But all I learned is how to import packages and how to plot graphs with functions. 


This course taught me a whole new realm for me. This is the last push that I needed to be confident with my learnings and apply them in real life and become industry ready.

Mayank sir a personal note to you:
I absolutely love your teaching style. You are taking your time when teaching and it's a great understanding from yourside. You understand that keep a good comfortable pace while teaching can help even a dumbo like me to grasp all the concepts and learning. I always ask lots of questions in the class and you catered all of the burning questions the WHY for doing something. 

I am very confident that I will nail my upcoming interview next week. Once again thank you so much for providing such invaluable knowledge to us :)

content:
Could you please remove unnecessary okay sound, in one sentence how many okay you have used, can you evaluate yourself.
Just started the course, my interest is in ETL data pipeline, wish I will be able to learn and implement in my own project. I have to collect data from postgresql database then clean it and use it in my reinforcement learning based project.
I have huge expectation from Krish and Mayank sir because they already did a lot of great work in youtube and udemy, thats why I can recommend this course for other beginners.
